full_text: Screened by NARA, 2/10/2023 OPTIONAL FORM NO. 10 MAY 1962 EDITION GSA FPMR (41 CFR) 101-11.6 UNITED STATES GOVERNMENT Memorandum A19 790 690 TO : File DATE: January 13, 1972 FROM : Roland L. Johnson, Deportation Officer Ryp Portland, Oregon SUBJECT: NGUYEN, Nhat Thi On January 11, 1972 a telephone call was received by District Director Pattillo from Miss Routio of the Washington, D. C. office of Congressman Dellenbach stating that subject would like a little more time and was in- formed it would be given if the Form I-94 was returned to this office. Form I-94, which was received with letter of January 10th from the son-in- law, James M. McGeever, has been endorsed to indicate that departure on or before February 17, 1972 will be considered as satisfactory compliance. Buy U.S. Savings Bonds Regularly on the Payroll Savings Plan 5010-109
